commitResults.messageBody:
Main class name (Duke) is generic.

Renamed the main class name to ChatterBox and
provided the skeletal code to simply greet user
and exit.

Greeting & Exiting was done within the main()
function, which may not be good practice especially
by exposing how the system is ran.

Created private functions greet() and exit() to
abstract away the details on how to greet and exit
the function.

This allows users to merely use the functions,
providing a clean interface and allow for easier
editing in the future.

Improved the skeletal version of ChatterBox such
that it now echoes commands entered by the user.

Functionality is created in the run() function,
which improves modularity and provides a clean
interface.

Lack of support for storing user input.

Created a Storage class which can store user input.
Storage class is a generic class in case we want
to store user input as other types of objects in
the future.

Code repetition for the initial "ChatterBox: " as
well as the lack of modularity for processing user input.

Created a processUserInput() function in order to abstract away
how user input is processed, and created a name variable to store
the initial output of "ChatterBox: ".

This helps to improve code modularity and improve readability,
maintainability and reusability.

Lack of support to store and display user input

Utilized the storage class to store user input,
and display user input when the user inputs 'list'
in the CLI.

Created a Task Class to handle user input's as Task
objects. This helps create better modularity.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to use Task Class
commitResults.messageBody:
User input was still stored as Strings in storage class.

Refactored code to create Task objects from user input
and store Task objects in the Storage object.

Lack of support for marking tasks in list.

Added support for marking tasks as complete / incomplete.
List of items done:
* Moved functionality for processing commands into a class
called CommandProcessor to improve modularity and extensibility.
* All commands are now processed via the CommandProcessor class,
with the exception of adding tasks since there is no command for now.
* Made the generic Storage class extend Task in order to access Task methods.
* Runnable interface is created in order to utilize lambda functions
for the commands.
* Scanner is passed into the CommandProcessor class methods in order
to prevent undefined behaviour from multiple scanners for I/O.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for various task types
commitResults.messageBody:
Lack of support for specific task types.

Changed Task class to be an ABC. Created TodoTask,
DeadlineTask & EventTask classes to support the 3 different
tasks available.

Task class now also stores a symbol for the type of Task, and
toString() for Task class now shows the symbol as well.

Previous CommandProcessor relied on Task class objects.

With the addition of new types of Tasks, we needed to
modify the CommandProcessor and ChatterBox class to support
it. CommandProcessor now takes in Storage<Task> as opposed
to Storage<T> for Runnable objects since we are only storing
Task objects in the storage object.

Lack of support for storing the various task types.

Added functionality by updating CommandProcessor to be
able to handle new commands.

NOTE: The logic for parsing the tokens may not be the
best practice and should be altered to the best practice
when possible.

Code for adding tasks was repetitive.

Refactored it such that adding tasks can be done through the addTask()
function. Also created a parseInput() function to parse the input
based on the delimiters present.

Lack of automated text UI testing

Added tests by simulating running multiple commands.
Tests compare the expected output vs actual output.
Tests for commands include:
* list
* mark
* unmark
* todo
* deadline
* event

Deadline Task did not store the deadline "from" attribute properly.

Fixed it by using the correct indices for the tokens after parsing.

Also updated some UI changes to show Chatbot name and provide
whitespaces.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for invalid input and error checking
commitResults.messageBody:
Lack of support for invalid inputs by user and error checking

Added a ChatterBoxException class for which runtime exceptions related
to ChatterBox will be thrown if necessary.

Altered the implementation of adding tasks by placing functionality
into try-catch blocks to facilitate error checking.

Additional input is also cleared and not processed.

Types of errors handled thus far:
* Out of bounds errors for mark, unmark
* Invalid input for mark, unmark
* Insufficient input for todo
* Insufficient / Invalid input for deadline, and event

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Automated TextUI Testing for handling error input
commitResults.messageBody:
Lack of automated testing for error input after updated code
that handles errors.

Updated the automated TextUI testing to include cases related
to error checking.

Tests include all branches possible at this point of time for
all the relevant commands.

Lack of support for deleting tasks.

Added support for deleting tasks via delete <index>.
Error checking is also implemented for deleting tasks

Lack of testing for delete feature

Added Automated TextUI Tests for delete feature
Tests Include:
* Deleting invalid index
* Deleting correct index
* Invalid input

When printing to output, code utilized System.out.println(name + ...)

Improved it by created a reply() function for when the chatbot replies.
This helps make the code more readable and ensures that changes to the
bot's name or reply can be done in one place.

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow Task Classes to set completion status upon construction
commitResults.messageBody:
Task Classes defaulted to incomplete when constructed

Added an overload for each Task Class's constructor
to take in a boolean for isCompleted. Also added getters
for DeadlineTask and EventTask attributes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for saving tasks to hard disk automatically
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous version of Chatbot could not store tasks
into memory.

Tasks can now be stored in a folder relative to
where the program is ran. These tasks are loaded
before user starts chatting. Tasks are saved
automatically after each update to the task list.

Currently does not handle corrupted data files.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add fail-safe for corrupted save files
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous version had no fail safe for corrupted data.

User will be informed if loading of data is corrupted.
Program will skip corrupted data and remove it from the
save file.

Merge the implementation of data saving into the
master branch.

commitResults.messageTitle: Store deadlines for DeadlineTask as LocalDateTime
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously stored deadlines as strings with no formatting.

Updated the code to store deadlines as LocalDateTime.
Deadlines now have to be inputted in the
dd-MM-YYYY HH:mm format and are outputted in the
MMM-d-YYYY HH:MM format.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test for new deadline DateTime format
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous test did not cover the new deadline DateTime
format.

Added a test as well as modified the expected output in
EXPECTED.TXT for the new DateTime format for deadline.

Merge the feature of DateTime formatting for deadlines
in DeadlineTask to master branch

Lack of a central UI for I/O related to the bot.

Created a ChatterBoxUI class in order to create a central class
for outputting bot messages. modified files such that messages
can be outputted by using the reply() member function.

Classes were not separated into packages

Separated all the classes thus far into their respective
packages. For classes that are dependent on each other,
they have been imported. For classes that require every
class in a package, the wildcard import is used.
Add gradle support to the main branch

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix main class name for Gradle Builds
commitResults.messageBody:
Gradle's configuration was set to default and was targeted for Duke

Altered the configuration so as to run the main program through
ChatterBox.java

Testing only included TextUI Tests for ChatterBox

Added JUnit automated unit testing for some non-trivial functions

Utilized a helper utility class called OutputCaptor which helps
capture the output that the program prints to console for checking

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc header comments for methods.
commitResults.messageBody:
Lack of JavaDoc comments for methods.

Added JavaDoc header comments for various public / private methods
in all classes. Methods that are trivial do not have header comments.

Lack of JavaDoc header comments for methods in master branch.

Updates the master branch such that class methods contain JavaDoc Header
comments.

Some files did not adhere to the coding standard provided.

Modified the files to ensure that the coding standard is followed.

Ensure that the code on the master branch adheres to the Coding
Standard.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for finding tasks by description
commitResults.messageBody:
Lack of support for finding tasks based on description.

Users can now use the find command to search for tasks
whose description contains a certain text.

If no tasks can be found, user will be notified through the command
line interface.
Merge the functionality of find command to the master branch

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JavaDoc headers for new functions
commitResults.messageBody:
Lack of JavaDoc Headers for functions created from the 'find' command.

Added JavaDoc Headers for the new functions implemented.

Include the JavaDoc header comments for the new functions
implemented to support 'find' command.

Lack of textUI testing for find command

Added tests for:
* Lack of description for find command
* Correct substring of description
* Invalid description
